questions.title: Two Numbers That Add Up (Explain)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find two numbers in a list that add up to a target, without writing full code.
followups: Why might remembering previous numbers help?
What edge case would you test?

questions.title: Reverse a String (Steps)
questions.prompt: Explain step by step how you would reverse a string like "google".
followups: How do you know when to stop?
How do you verify the result?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses (Idea Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if parentheses in a string are correctly matched.
followups: Give a valid and invalid example.
How would you explain this simply?

questions.title: Binary Search (Concept)
questions.prompt: Explain how binary search works on a sorted list, without writing code.
followups: Why must the list be sorted?
What does cutting the list in half mean?

questions.title: Find Maximum Value
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find the maximum value in a list of numbers.
followups: How do you track the largest value?
What if the list has one number?

questions.title: Palindrome Check
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a word is a palindrome.

questions.title: FizzBuzz (Reasoning)
questions.prompt: Explain the rules of FizzBuzz and how you would solve it.
followups: What common mistake do beginners make?
How do you keep the code readable?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Arrays (High Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would merge two sorted arrays into one sorted array.
followups: What happens when one array finishes?

questions.title: Hash Map (Basic Use)
questions.prompt: Explain what a hash map is and when it is useful.
followups: What is stored as the key and value?

questions.title: Recursion (Basic Idea)
questions.prompt: Explain recursion using a simple example.
followups: What happens if there is no base case?

questions.title: Stacks (Practical Understanding)
questions.prompt: Explain what a stack is using a real-life example.

questions.title: Queues (Practical Understanding)
questions.prompt: Explain what a queue is using a real-life example.
followups: How is this different from a stack?

questions.title: Array vs Linked List (Simple Difference)
questions.prompt: Explain one main difference between arrays and linked lists.

questions.title: Big-O (Plain English)
questions.prompt: Explain what Big-O helps programmers understand, without formulas.
followups: When is a simple solution enough?

questions.title: Tree Traversal (High Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you might visit all nodes in a tree.
followups: What does visiting a node mean?

questions.title: Detect Duplicates
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a list contains duplicate values.
followups: Why does tracking seen values help?
What happens if the list is large?

questions.title: Reverse a Linked List (Concept)
questions.prompt: Explain the idea behind reversing a linked list.
followups: What edge case would you test?

questions.title: Graph Basics
questions.prompt: Explain what a graph is using a real-world example.

questions.title: Unit Testing (Purpose)
questions.prompt: Explain why developers write unit tests.

questions.title: Handling Errors
questions.prompt: Explain how you would handle errors in a simple program.

questions.title: Loops vs Recursion
questions.prompt: Explain one difference between loops and recursion.

questions.title: Variables Scope
questions.prompt: Explain what variable scope means.
followups: What problems happen with global variables?

questions.title: Functions (Design)
questions.prompt: Explain why small functions are better than very large ones.
followups: How do small functions help testing?
What happens with very large functions?

questions.title: APIs (Basic Use)
questions.prompt: Explain how an app might use an API to get data.
followups: Why not store all data locally?
What kind of data might an API return?

questions.title: REST APIs (Simple)
questions.prompt: Explain what a REST API is using a simple example.

questions.title: Frontend vs Backend
questions.prompt: Explain how frontend and backend work together in an app.

questions.title: Debugging Mindset
questions.prompt: Your code does not work. Explain how you would start debugging.
followups: When do you ask for help?

questions.title: Why Google?
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Google?
followups: What Google product do you like?
What excites you about problem solving?
What do you want to learn at Google?
